results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Norman Athersmith and Peter Lindon
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Five short segments cover a range of physical education activities from babyhood to late primary age. Includes segments on kindergym, eurythmics, the Lady George Kindergarten and on creative dance.

results.creator_credit: Walter Reed Army Institute of Research

results.title: Mouth to mouth (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Vega Film Productions, Victorian Film Corporation, John Sainken and John Duigan
results.brief_description: Two teenage girls escape from a youth training centre and head for the city finding work in a food bar. Eventually they end up sharing a derelict warehouse with two unemployed boys they have met, one from an Italian family and the other from the country, and for awhile the openness and warmth of their relationships transcend their depressing economic circumstances. This is a film about survival, interpersonal relationships and the inevitable disintegration of the group. Cast includes Kim Krejus, Sonia Peat, Ian Gilmour, Sergio Frazetto. Cinematography by Tow Cowan; Nigel Buesst as camera assistant.

results.title: Moussorgsky: 'Pictures at an exhibition'
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Music in Motion”.
Scenes of the flower gardens at Paris’ Louvre and Tuileries Park, children playing, fluffy chicks running about, the bustling market place at Limoges and the Paris Catacombs are shown to express part of Moussorgsky’s composition “Pictures at an Exhibition”. The composer wrote the music to pay homage to paintings by his friend Victor Hartmann.

results.title: Mousehunt
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Alan Richie, Tony Ludwig, Bruce Cohen and Gore Verbinski
results.brief_description: When their elderly father dies, two brothers inherit the family business - the Smuntz string factory - along with a dilapidated house. Ernie Smuntz (Nathan Lane) was a once revered chef but is no more thanks to an unfortunate incident involving the mayor and a cockroach; brother Lars (Lee Evans) is a devoted string factory worker. On viewing the house they discover that it was designed by a revered architect at the turn of the century and is potentially worth millions. The only obstacle to the impending fortune is one wily long time resident, a mouse that’s proving impossible to catch. Christopher Walken has a brief role as a pest exterminator. The film is rated PG due to potentially horrible traps laid by each opponent, including a freakish cat. Cast also includes Vicki Lewis, Eric Christmas and Maury Chaykin.

results.title: Mouse around
results.brief_description: This very sweet film, with no dialogue, is the tale of a small mouse who is asleep in its nest in the basement of his house when a plumber calls to fix some leaky pipes. Tha mouse is awakened and moves to the edge of the nest to have a look, but it leans over too far and falls out into the plumbers coveralls. The charming story follows the little mouse’s adventures as he is transported around town from person until it eventually makes it safely back to the nest. Suitable for Kindergarten and Lower Primary students.

results.title: Mouse-activated candle lighter
results.creator_credit: Prism Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: The mouse-activated candle lighter illustrates various forms of potential and kinetic energy. It is made from a mousetrap, fishing rod, alarm clock, ice-pack, train motor, rubberband, match and candle. Students are challenged to find the many forms of energy hidden in the mechanism and their movements. Suitable for secondary level.
